title: Drawing, "Design for a table clock", 1780
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, traces of graphite, on white laid paper
markings: Stamp, lower right: Cooper-Union Museum, New York
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Two fluted pilasters flank circular dial. Above, a pediment consisting of a covered urn on top, a garland of laurel leaves, and a shell in the recessed section of the pediment. A trophy decorated with leaves and a bow, in lower panel. Partial view of covered urns on either side of base, cushioned feet.
